page.title: 01General Introduction.
page.content:
2 GENERAL INTRODUCTION TO AREA.
The 6X4 kilometre square we have been given the task of surveying is to the north east of a town called Devizes. Devizes is a historic market town in Wiltshire, with a population of approximatly 10,000 people. The block we surveyed is initialy a rural area, but it has a number of secondary roles to play in the life of the surrounding area. These roles include agriculture, defence, industry and a small area is used for residential purposes. Running through the area is the London road which gives direct access to Swindon, the main industrial centre in the area. Along this stretch of road, there are two petrol stations, one of them has breakdown and garage facilities to serve the road.
